statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Chris De La Rosa scored 23 points to help Maryland-Baltimore County defeat Boston University 71-67 in America East Conference action on Monday night.
article.headline: BU blows late lead in loss against host UMBC
article.linkText: BU blows late lead in loss against host UMBC
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Chris De La Rosa scored 23 points to help Maryland-Baltimore County defeat Boston University 71-67 in America East Conference action on Monday night. The Retrievers (2-16, 1-4) trailed 64-55 with 4:45 left to play before two free throws from Adrian Satchell and a 3-pointer by Laurence Jolicoeur cut UMBC's deficit to 64-60. De La Rosa hit a 3 and Justin Fry made two free throws to tie the score at 67 with 1:12 remaining. Satchell, who finished with 11 points, scored the final four to seal the win for the Retrievers, who snapped a four-game losing streak. UMBC led 16-3 after a 3-pointer from Jamar Wertz with 14:14 left in the first half, but Boston scored eight straight to pull within five, 16-11, less than 2 minutes later. John Holland scored 24 points for the Terriers (8-11, 3-2). Darryl Partin added 18 and Matt Griffin 15.
